001package imagingbook.lib.math;
002
003public interface RealEigensolver {
004        
005        /**
006         * Returns {@code true} iff all eigenvalues of the associated matrix are real.
007         * @return as described
008         */
009        public boolean isReal();
010        
011        /**
012         * Returns a vector of eigenvalues, sorted by magnitude (in descending order).
013         * {@code Double.Nan} is inserted for complex eigenvalues.
014         * Note that the method returns a reference to an internal
015         * array and thus results should be used read-only!
016         * @return an array of eigenvalues
017         */
018        public double[] getEigenvalues();
019        
020        /**
021         * Returns the k-th eigenvalue (&lambda;_k, for k = 0,...,N-1).
022         * Eigenvalues are sorted by magnitude (in descending order).
023         * {@code Double.Nan} is returned if the associated eigenvalue
024         * is complex-valued (non-real).
025         * @param k index 
026         * @return the k-th eigenvalue
027         */
028        public double getEigenvalue(int k);
029        
030        /**
031         * Returns the k-th eigenvector.
032         * The ordering of the returned eigenvectors is the same as for the
033         * eigenvalues returned by {@link #getEigenvalues()}.
034         * @param k index
035         * @return the k-th eigenvector
036         */
037        public double[] getEigenvector(int k);
038
039}
